what: DiatoViz provides templates for plotting in R
title: DiatoViz provides templates for plotting in R
text: DiatoViz R package developed diatomists. DiatoViz package provides simple function add silhouettes diatoms plots generated ggplot2. Currently, package contains 89 diatom silhouettes. silhouettes diatoms created using SHERPA software (Kloster et al.¬†2014).

title: DiatoViz provides templates for plotting in R
text: can install development version DiatoViz GitHub R package remotes:

title: DiatoViz provides templates for plotting in R
text: use Diatoviz, species list must formatted specific abbreviations provided Omnidia software. main function geom_diatom_code() geometry draws diatom species shapes. can see current available diatoms plot.
code: library(tidyverse) library(DiatoViz)  diatoms <- DiatoViz::valid_diatom_code()  df_example <- data.frame(   a = c(rep(1:5, 17),c(1,2,3,4)),   b = sort(c(rep(1:17, 5), c(0,0,0,0)), decreasing = TRUE),   species = diatoms) %>%   slice(1:30)  ggplot(df_example, aes(x = a, y = b)) +   geom_diatom_code(aes(diatom_code = species), height = 0.1) +   geom_label(aes(label = species), nudge_y = -0.45) +   theme_void()+   theme(plot.margin = margin(15,15,15,15,"pt"))+   coord_cartesian(clip = "off")

title: Standardize diatoms code ‚Äî clean_diatom_code
text: function standardizes diatoms code.

title: Standardize diatoms code ‚Äî clean_diatom_code
text: code character vector abbreviations keep_non_matches TRUE (default) element code matched internal mapping vectors kept . Otherwise replaced NA.

title: Standardize diatoms code ‚Äî clean_diatom_code
text: character vector length code cleaned diatoms code included diatom_code_abbr_mapping. Non matches may replaced NA (depending value keep_non_matches).

title: Alternate diatom code mapping ‚Äî diatom_code_abbr_mapping
text: named character vector mapping common alternate diatoms codes.

title: Alternate diatom code mapping ‚Äî diatom_code_abbr_mapping
text: named character vector name attribute "alternate" name. value attribute "correct" name.

what: ggplot2 Layer for visualizing the silhouettes of diatoms. ‚Äî geom_diatom_code
title: ggplot2 Layer for visualizing the silhouettes of diatoms. ‚Äî geom_diatom_code
text: geom used plot silhouettes diatoms instead points ggplot. requires x, y aesthetics well valid diatoms code. latter can checked valid_diatom_code().

title: ggplot2 Layer for visualizing the silhouettes of diatoms. ‚Äî geom_diatom_code
code: geom_diatom_code(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = FALSE,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: ggplot2 Layer for visualizing the silhouettes of diatoms. ‚Äî geom_diatom_code
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). stat statistical transformation use data layer, either ggproto Geom subclass string naming stat stripped stat_ prefix (e.g. "count" rather "stat_count") position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. ... arguments passed ggplot2::layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value. See section "Aesthetics" full list possible arguments. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders().

title: ggplot2 Layer for visualizing the silhouettes of diatoms. ‚Äî geom_diatom_code
text: ggplot2 layer (ggplot2::layer()) can added plot created ggplot2::ggplot().

title: ggplot2 Layer for visualizing the silhouettes of diatoms. ‚Äî geom_diatom_code
text: geom_diatom_code() understands following aesthetics (required aesthetics bold): x - x-coordinate. y - y-coordinate. diatom_code - diatoms codes. one valid_diatom_code(). function tries clean diatom codes internally calling clean_diatom_code(). alpha = NULL - alpha channel, .e. transparency level, numerical value 0 1. colour = NULL - image colorized colour. Use special character "b/w" set black white. information valid colour names ggplot2 see https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/articles/ggplot2-specs.html?q=colour#colour--fill angle = 0 - angle image numerical value 0¬∞ 360¬∞. hjust = 0.5 - horizontal adjustment relative given x coordinate. Must numerical value 0 1. vjust = 0.5 - vertical adjustment relative given y coordinate. Must numerical value 0 1. width = 1.0 - desired width image npc (Normalised Parent Coordinates). default value set 1.0 big necessary used values computed relative default. typical size width = 0.075 (see examples). height = 1.0 - desired height image npc (Normalised Parent Coordinates). default value set 1.0 big necessary used values computed relative default. typical size height = 0.1 (see examples).
